means: 堆积，聚集(heap的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: He heaped abuse on Waite and made venomous personal attacks.
sentence.Network_cn: 他肆意辱骂韦特，并对他进行恶毒的人身攻击。

sentence.Network_en: Mrs. Madrigal heaped more carrots onto Michael'splate.
sentence.Network_cn: 马德里加尔夫人将更多的胡萝卜堆到了迈克尔的盘子里。

sentence.Network_en: Add one heaped tablespoon of salt.

The crowd heaped the singer with praise ., 人群大加赞扬这个歌手.
Sometimes the clouds heaped up in heavy masses ., 有时云堆成厚厚的一团团.

entry.def: A heaped spoonful has the contents of the spoon piled up above the edge.

example.ex: Add one heaped tablespoon of salt.

entry.def: A container or a surface that is heaped with things has a lot of them in it or on it in a pile, often so many that it cannot hold any more.

example.ex: The large desk was heaped with papers.

auth_sentence.content: The result has heaped further pressure on Mr Cameron.
auth_sentence.res_content: The result has heaped further pressure on Mr Cameron.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The result has heaped further pressure on Mr Cameron.

auth_sentence.content: There were brand-new suitcases heaped in the guest room.
